title: SCP-7171
content:

[[include :scp-wiki:component:rso]]
[[module CSS]]

#page-content > .collapsible-block {
     background-color: #cacaca45;
}

.doc {
    background-color: rgb(var(--bright-accent));
    color: white;
    font-family: var(--mono-font);
    padding: 0 1.5rem;
    font-size: 1.1em;
    width: fit-content;
    position: relative;
    top: -2em;
    border-radius: 4px;
    margin-bottom: -2rem;
}

#header::before {
    height: calc(100% - var(--topbar-height-on-desktop));
    aspect-ratio: 1;
    left: 50%;
    top: 0.3rem;
    background-image: url(http://scpdsandbox.wikidot.com/local--files/collab:sirslash-abrethe-7kon/logo.png);
    background-size: contain;
    transform: translatex(-50%);
    filter: invert(1);
}

#header::after {
    content: "";
    display: block;
    position: absolute;
    background: white;
    opacity: 0.01;
    height: 25.5%;
    width: 0.5rem;
    bottom: 53%;
    left: calc(50% - 0.25rem);
    transform-origin: bottom center;
    transform: rotate(calc(360deg - 30deg * var(--minutes-to-midnight)/60));
}

[[/module]]

------
[[size 150%]]CLASSIFIED BY THE DoPA: SCP-7171[[/size]]
[[size 125%]]{{CODENAME: "Binary Beyond"}}[[/size]]
[[/=]]

[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]

----

[[include :scp-wiki:component:classified-bar-woed
|lv=5
|item=7171
|oc=Tiamat
|lang=EN
]]

----

[[div class="scp-image-block block-center" style="width:90%;"]]
[[image http://scpdsandbox.wikidot.com/local--files/collab:sirslash-abrethe-7kon/asteroid.jpg style="width:90%;" link=#]]
[[div class="scp-image-caption" style="width:100%;"]]
{{Fig 2.1}} -- Photograph of an asteroid falling above the city of Leeuwarden, Netherlands. Picture taken 15 hours after SCP-7171-α.
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

----

**SPECIAL CONTAINMENT PROCEDURES:** As of 2029, SCP-7171 has reached its perihelion. However, due to the current state of technology and the massive distance there is between SCP-7171 and Earth, containment is currently deemed implausible. Otherwise, the anomaly is to be kept under constant surveillance by Jupiter-stationed Foundation probes to determine whether the most plausible contingency plan should be activated or not.

**SPECIFIC CONTINGENCY PROTOCOLS:** The "containment" of SCP-7171 is to be centered around the dissemination of misinformation to the public, no matter the current status of modern society. The SCP Foundation is to be represented as a non-governmental organization dedicated to the protection of humanity and the survival of human civilization. A plausible excuse or cover story is to be developed and scattered across the remnants of society to hide the true nature of SCP-7171-α.

Should any personnel enter a state of panic because of the impending XK-Class ("End of the World") Scenario, they are to be detained and sedated. Patience is to be kept until a solution to SCP-7171-α is found.

Further containment procedures are currently being drafted and decided by the O5 Council and the Foundation's higher administration. Dr. Maurice Arkand has been promoted as the Department of Para-Astronomy's head, and all suggestions and complaints regarding SCP-7171 are to be redirected to him for the time being.

----

**DESCRIPTION:** SCP-7171 is the designation given to a Class-XI tychekinetic Trans-Neptunian Object (TNO), currently located 25 AU away from the Sun. Prior to SCP-7171-α, SCP-7171 took the form of a contact binary[[footnote]]Contact binaries are singular celestial bodies composed of the conjunction between 2 bodies.[[/footnote]]comprised of 2 diminutive asteroids, both estimating an approximate length of 5 km in diameter each.

SCP-7171 was, until SCP-7171-α occurred, the originator of the Solar System's baseline, local probability. However, following SCP-7171-α, SCP-7171's primary properties were heavily affected, thus altering local probability on a gargantuan scale. In other words, things that were deemed very unlikely or almost impossible to happen were now given a higher chance of occurring depending on how damaged SCP-7171 was.

SCP-7171-α refers to an event caused by the sudden impact of SCP-7171 with an indeterminate object, presumed to be an asteroid of similar diameter. The exact details of SCP-7171-α's origin are unknown, but it is known that:

* SCP-7171-α's occurrence is extremely detrimental to SCP-7171 and its properties, as it is now vulnerable to other objects within the Kuiper Belt.
* SCP-7171-α occurred spontaneously and by chance.
* SCP-7171-α's occurrence resulted in SCP-7171 being heavily damaged, as one of its 2 sections is now cracked and a small crater has been formed in it. This was captured by one of Project FORTUNA-ASTREA's probes prior to deactivation.

As SCP-7171 resulted in baseline probability being heavily altered, the chances of natural catastrophes occurring are now higher. See Addendum 1 for more information.

----

**AUDIO LOG:** 11/06/2029

On the late morning of 07/06/2029, following the discovery of SCP-7171 on Neptune's orbit by a modified //Hestia// probe, all contact with it was lost and a global power outage occurred for 40 seconds. The following is a phone call conducted by Dr. Maurice Arkand while analyzing images of SCP-7171.
@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
[[div class="doc"]]
AUDIO LOG
[[/div]]

= **[BEGIN LOG]**

(//A beeping sound can be heard. Suddenly, it stops. Somebody picks up the call.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** Hello? Is anybody there?

**Unknown:** Yes, who is this?

**Dr. Arkand:** This is the Site Director's office, right? My name is Maurice Arkand, all pow-

**Unknown:** Oh, right, Maurice. I- We've lost power here. We've tried to connect with other sites but only those with radio signatures answered. It's Maya, uh, Maya Dawson, by the way.

**Dr. Arkand:** What are you doing in there?

**Dr. Dawson:** Night shift. The Site Director's been escorted to a safe bunker. Nobody knows why, but it's probably because of the explosion.

**Dr. Arkand:** Explosion?

**Dr. Dawson:** Why, yes. Didn't you hear it? Everybody thinks there's a terrorist attack going on. Turns out-

**Dr. Arkand:** Do you know anything about SCP-7171?

**Dr. Dawson:** No, not really. Why do you ask?

**Dr. Arkand:** Shit. I'll tell you back in the observatory. This isn't good.

**Dr. Dawson:** Maurice, what is going on in there?

**Dr. Arkand:** We've found the epicenter of the SCP-7171 phenomenon. We've lost all contact with the probe. It stopped sending signals and photos.

**Dr. Dawson:** Wait, what?

**Dr. Arkand:** Come down here as soon as possible. I have to go.

**Dr. Dawson:** Wa-

(//Dr. Arkand hangs the call.//)

(//Silence. A crashing sound is heard in the background.//)

**Dr. Dawson:** Oh my god!

(//Running is heard.//)

= **[END LOG]**
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]

= **[CONTINUE LOG]**

**Dr. Arkand:** Reading this document doesn't make it seem too bad. But, you've seen everything with your own eyes, right?

**O5-4:** I still don't understand why you added that log to the file. This seems...

**Dr. Arkand:** Yes, it seems off. But that girl went through a lot of things, if I may say so.

(//Silence.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** Maya was a very sweet woman. She died at a pretty young age. It's... Tough. She always came home to have a chit-chat and discuss astrophysics or day-to-day stuff. She was my right hand back during the SCP-7171 project until she passed away.

**O5-4:** What role did she play in the project?

**Dr. Arkand:** She was the one who compiled statistics and recent news for the project. She would also share her findings with the rest of the Foundation, so... Yeah, that actually wasn't me. It's...

**O5-4:** I see. What happened to her?

(//Dr. Arkand can be seen putting on a sad smile.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** I- Something got in her water during lunch. Then... O-Oh...

(//Arkand begins weeping. As soon as he's about to speak up, he breaks into crying.//)

**O5-4:** ...Oh. Would you... Would you like to conclude...

(//Dr. Arkand rests his head on the table and puts his hand on his head as he begins crying uncontrollably. Following this, O5-4 stands up.//)

**O5-4:** Thought you'd like to conclude here.

(//O5-4 leaves.//)

= **[END LOG]**

[[/div]]

@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]

**ADDENDUM 7171.1:** Timeline Log.

Following the events of SCP-7171-α, orbital and behavioural alterations have been registered across the Sol System. Below is a concise list of SCP-7171's perceived effects as of 7 days after SCP-7171-α.

* Objects in the Kuiper Belt and its proximities have suffered significant modifications in their orbits, causing many asteroids to gain acceleration and abandon the Kuiper Belt. Said asteroids are expected to traverse both in and outside the Sol System, judging by their current situation. SCP-7000's integrity is at high risk and other bodies in the Sol System could be affected by similar effects in the nearby future.

* The number of solar flares observed on Sol's surface have increased by 200%. This poses a risk of a geomagnetic storm in the near future if this behaviour is to continue. This geomagnetic storm could potentially damage electrical equipment on Earth, putting several Foundation Sites at risk of containment breaches.

* The height of tidal waves has increased by an average of 2 meters. While not confirmed, this may be due to SCP-7171 direct effects on Luna. A short study conducted by AIC Binary Star suggests that the orbit of the Earth's moon has reduced its radius and will most likely continue to do so in the future. A collision with Earth could happen in a time span of 15 years.

Because of this, the Department of Para-Astronomy has officially recognized the threat that SCP-7171 now poses to the Foundation and humanity as a whole. The results of SCP-7171's effects could lead to both a potential IK-Class ("Collapse Of Global Civilization") Scenario, and a devastating PK-Class ("Probability Restructuring") Scenario. Site-47's main focus is now set on the containment of SCP-7171 and damage control.

The following is a timeline of several events that have occurred globally because of SCP-7171.

**UPDATE 1/08/2029:** Two months after SCP-7171-α, the previously detailed effects have continued to occur and increased significantly in intensity. Human society as a whole has observed and experienced the effects of SCP-7171. While the Veil has been maintained, humanity as a whole has already acknowledged the situation and several countries are in a permanent state of alarm. All Foundation Sites have ceased their primary research functions regarding low-priority anomalies.

----

**UPDATE 7/08/2029:** An unprecedented earthquake of magnitude 7.3 occurred in South Carolina, demolishing Site-19. Several containment breaches occurred, however, a new set of safety protocols prevented many personnel casualties.

----

**UPDATE 12/08/2029:** Abnormal weather conditions have been observed in Europe and Western Asia. This has resulted in a major decrease in food production. The use of self-replicating food anomalies has been considered to reduce the effects of famine caused by current events. Approval pending.

----

**UPDATE 17/08/2029:** On this day, a meteorite impacted Site-47's South Building[[footnote]]This building was the Department of Anomalous Manufacturing's base of operations.[[/footnote]]. Despite measuring approximately 300 meters prior to entering Earth's atmosphere, the meteorite lost only 16% of its original mass as opposed to the average 95% in all other cases. The meteorite that landed on Site-47 was noted to be 9 meters long. The other half of the meteorite, which landed in Kansas, United States, was reported to have a length of 16 meters upon impact.

The following transcript was attached to the log.

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
[[div class="doc"]]
VIDEO LOG
[[/div]]

**DATE:** 17/08/2029

----

**Assisting Personnel:** Dr. Maya Dawson, Agt. Helen Lindberg, Dr. Maurice Arkand

----

= **[BEGIN LOG]**

(//Dr. Dawson is waiting next to the debris of Site-47's south building. Agent Lindberg and Dr. Arkand arrive in an armoured vehicle.//)

**Dr. Dawson:** Why'd you guys take so long?

**Dr. Arkand:** Interferences. Possibly the geomag storm. Are you alright?

**Dr. Dawson:** Yeah. I wasn't in the building when it collapsed. It did catch five people inside though. They've already been transported to the sick bay for treatment.

**Dr. Arkand:** Yeah, I've heard.

**Agent Lindberg:** Alright, dear. I think we should get moving.

(//Dr. Dawson gets in the back of the car.//)

**Dr. Dawson:** How is the rest of the Site doing?

**Dr. Arkand:** Not good, for sure. Everyone is losing their cool. This incident, summed up with the multiple containment breaches occurring at other sites is really putting everyone crazy. They can't go back home, they can't see their families... On top of that, a lot of people are being moved to a new position to help with densely populated cities, and SCP-7171.

**Dr. Dawson:** Has the O5 Council said anything?

**Dr. Arkand:** No, the last time we heard anything of them was over a week ago. I've been trying to catch their attention with the whole building incident but they are so adamant about not reading my messages.

**Dr. Dawson:** Maybe something happened to them, who knows?

(//Agent Lindberg looks at Dr. Dawson from the vehicle's rear-view mirror.//)

**Agt. Lindberg:** The Council? (//Chuckles.//) They have the best protection on the entire planet, they'll be the last ones to go down, if not you or me.

**Dr. Dawson:** Fair enough. I mean, at least Site-47 and the Para-Astronomy Department have a ton more funds now, right?

(//Agent Lindberg shakes her head before focusing on the road again.//)

**Agt. Lindberg:** Yes, it really does. Have you seen the department foreman's new car, sweetheart?

(//Lindberg laughs.//)

**Agent Lindberg:** Here's the deal. The O5s are putting themselves on the front lines and leaving us in the dark as if they were some kind of heroes. They don't really care about where the funding goes as long as it "comes here". I'm honestly surprised they've never done this before.

**Dr. Arkand:** Haven't they, though?

**Agt. Lindberg:** Heh, you got me there.

**Dr. Arkand:** Anyway, Maya. Were you able to salvage anything from the destroyed building?

**Dr. Dawson:** I did recover my schematics and tools but all of the heavy equipment has been destroyed, I doubt we can use any of it. The //Hestia// blueprints are trashed. Ripped apart, made into pieces. I've heard the comms system has been recently transferred though.

**Dr. Arkand** Fair enough. So... Any ideas? How are we meant to fix this?

(//Dr. Dawson pats Dr. Arkand's shoulder and smiles slightly.//)

**Dr. Dawson:** We'll figure something out. Of course, if the O5s stop trying to score good solutions.

(//Silence.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** You're right.

(//Dr. Arkand sighs.//)

**Dr. Dawson:** Hey, uh... Do you remember when we started the project?

**Dr. Arkand:** I do. Why?

(//Dr. Dawson smiles.//)

**Dr. Dawson:** You remember the party after the project was approved? The whole department was there, even Albert. Well, that's probably one of the most fun moments I've had in years, if not the most.

**Dr. Arkand:** Well, it sure was a good party.

**Dr. Dawson:** My point is that you're more than just a worker, Maurice. You and Lacroix are my closest friends. Probably the best. We've been there for each other in our highs and we will remain together for our lows, right?

**Dr. Arkand:** I- ...Nevermind. You're right. I guess we will.

**Agt. Lindberg:** Nice chit-chat you got going on there, but what about me? (//Smiles.//)

(//Dr. Dawson giggles.//)

**Dr. Dawson:** You're okay, I guess.

(//Agt. Lindberg snickers.//)

**Agt. Lindberg:** Oh, come on.

(//Silence. Dr. Arkand stops recording.//)

= **[END LOG]**

[[/div]]

Site-47's South Building is currently under structural reconstruction and repairs. It is expected to be functional again within the next 30 days.

----

**UPDATE 21/08/2029:** A massive storm converges around Juneau and Site-94, Alaska. Shortly thereafter, a larger snowstorm manifested throughout the entirety of Kamchatka and Alaska. Approximately 1.540 individuals died due to avalanches. Site-94 was successfully decommissioned and all of its personnel were evacuated to a secure bunker on Kodiak Island.

----

**UPDATE 22/08/2029:** Mercury is engulfed by a massive solar flare. Solar flares slightly grow in size and amount. Mercury has been shattered into much smaller pieces, some of which were attracted to the Sun.

----

**UPDATE 25/08/2029:** Protocol EREBUS is successfully developed. Using anomalous eigenweaponry, any impending, physical calamities will be completely abolished via violent force. Further details are yet to be released by the O5 Council.

----

**UPDATE 31/08/2029:** The Kuiper Belt breaks down. All objects within it begin moving freely across space, covering Neptune and Eris in a myriad of asteroids.

----

**UPDATE 02/09/2029:** A massive asteroid flies over Berlin, Germany. Protocol EREBUS was activated and the asteroid was destroyed. However, its remains fall over the rest of Western Europe. Several municipalities located across the United Kingdom, Southern Norway, and France were affected by this, though only 143 casualties were reported in total.

----

**UPDATE 05/09/2029:** A virus of unknown origin manifests in the Namib Desert, decimating Karakul Sheep populations.

----

**UPDATE 07/09/2029:** See video log.

----

[[<]]

SCP-7171 poses a Tiamat-Class threat to the Foundation's mission and the survival of humanity. However, under the current circumstances, the Veil will remain. The Foundation will not refrain from providing humanitarian help, using any conventional means such as cover stories, amnestization, and other methodologies. The O5 Council will oversee any projects regarding SCP-7171 and will discuss the matter of funding its containment.

The aforementioned discussion has been recorded in the form of a log fragment:

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
[[div class="doc"]]
VIDEO LOG
[[/div]]

**DATE:** 07/09/2029

**Assisting Personnel:** O5-1 to -13.

----

= **[BEGIN LOG]**

(//The following is a fragment of the meeting transcript. The O5 Council has been discussing for over 5 hours non-stop, excluding other additional meetings regarding the Foundation's administration.//)

**O5-4:** ...act. The situation is getting out of hand and there might be no turning back if we wait for too long.

**O5-6:** I've already stated my thoughts. I think we should just neutralize it.

**O5-9:** Pretty much. It's bound to neutralize itself anyway. Maybe we should start an evacuation project?

**O5-3:** Didn't we have one of these going on already?

**O5-1:** (//Sighing.//) Let's just...

**O5-5:** You all know all of this is happening because it is destroying itself, right?

**O5-12:** And what do we do then? Shoot other asteroids with a laser gun?

(//Silence.//)

**O5-3:** Maybe shooting lasers won't be successful. But we could send another probe.

**O5-2:** Oh, yes. Equip it with a drone. If we're lucky enough it might be able to fill 7171's cracks or clean it from any rubble. Maybe "fix" it?

**O5-8:** A probe would prove worthless against SCP-7171's effects. The closer it gets to it, the more the likelihood of it being destroyed increases exponentially. The chance of Nyx piercing through the surface of Hydra was extremely unlikely, but look at what happened. Unlikely things are now likely to happen because of this... This turgid thing.

**O5-7:** I agree with Eight. There is no guarantee that that will work, at all.

**O5-11:** I mean. Maybe, just maybe, its effects could be overpowered by sending enough drones and probes so that the possibilities of all of them failing are minimum to practically none. If it's just about trying enough times, then... Why- Why don't we try every single time at once?

**O5-4:** We're in the middle of a humanitarian crisis right now and the production cost of each of those probes is incredibly expensive. Considering our situation, this is way over our capabilities.

**O5-11:** Then we will have to use everything we've got and redirect all of our funds to them.

**O5-9:** To what purpose? Just, for what? To waste our money on something that might not even work? This will cost lives, lots of lives.

**O5-6:** That is correct. It's obviously gonna cost us a ton of lives, of course. But, would you rather risk a ton of lives, or all of humanity?

(//The room falls into silence.//)

**O5-4:** Anything to add? No?

(//More silence.//)

**O5-4:** I think have come to a consensus. I appreciate your assistance, gentlemen.

= **[END LOG]**

[[/div]]
[[/<]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
[[div class="doc"]]
COUNCIL VOTE SUMMARY
[[/div]]

[[div class="addendum"]]

**DATE:** 21/04/2034

**INTERVIEWER:** O5-4

**INTERVIEWEE:** Dr. Maurice Arkand

----

= **[BEGIN LOG]**

**O5-4:** Good evening, once again.

**Dr. Arkand:** Evening.

**O5-4:** How are you doing today? Better?

(//Silence.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** ... Better. Yes.

**O5-4:** I see. Back at where we left yesterday. I've been reading the second revision of SCP-7171's file. Not bad, may I say. Dr. Arkand, do you have any idea as to what happened to the rest of your department's members?

**Dr. Arkand:** What is this kind of question?

**O5-4:** We've sent something back to Earth to scan for people. If I recall from the file, the manufacturing building was destroyed right when a meteor fell on it, but not many people were affected, as far as I know. In fact, you said some of them were treated in the Medical Wing, right?

**Dr. Arkand:** Uh... Yeah. That's right. Also, did you just say //something?//

**O5-4:** Indeed.

**Dr. Arkand:** Are you talking about Binary Star?

**O5-4:** Yes, but that's not the case right now. What happened to your co-workers, Dr. Arkand?

**Dr. Arkand:** I don't know.

(//Silence.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** I wasn't even the department head.

**O5-4:** But you were a very popular and prominent member.

**Dr. Arkand:** Well yes, but I'm not omnipresent. Most of them just... Vanished into thin air. I just stopped hearing of them. Some of them were confined within the main building but not even there things were going right. I can tell that because... Well, one of our engineers, Albert Lacroix, they were in there. But they would often escape the curfew to come to the observatory, with me. Maya also did the same.

**O5-4:** You should've been confined as well.

**Dr. Arkand:** I //was// confined until you organized and passed that vote. Everybody was there, but then I spent the rest of my years in the Site's observatory when things began going pretty wrong. Mostly when you told me to.

**O5-4:** I see. I see. What about Dr. Lacroix?

**Dr. Arkand:** They were a very nice pal. They witnessed more things during Alpha than most of us did. They would've told you many more things than I'm telling you, but just because they knew more. They were always watching the probes. You know what happened to them? They grabbed a revolver out of their pocket and put it to their head. They escaped the Foundation and ran into the afterlife, much like Maya.

**O5-4:** Did they hold an important role within the project?

**Dr. Arkand:** They designed the probes.

**O5-4:** Then they must've been a valued member, from what I see. I apologize for your loss, Maurice.

**Dr. Arkand:** Oh, it's okay. It was bound to happen.

**O5-4:** I've also read the file. Much like in the other explorations, it seems as if something's missing. You attached these personal logs that occurred during Alpha but not what we need. You said it yesterday. It's a research project made to understand things, not to-

**Dr. Arkand:** Yes, I know. But you're here to ask me about the things I didn't add to the file, right? Not the ones I //did// add.

(//Silence.//)

**O5-4:** Alright, alright. I see.

= **[STOP LOG]**

[[/div]]

@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@
@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]

**ADDENDUM 7171.2:** Exploration Log.

Following the orders of the O5 Council, Site-47's personnel and several other Foundation facilities have begun the development of a modified version of the Foundation Standard Landing Probe, equipped with several kilograms of rock and a drone capable of interacting with SCP-7171.

Additionally, Foundation AIC Binary Star has been linked with all of the probes for real-time assessment. Binary Star will remain operational even if the probes are damaged, as long as at least one of them remains stable. The probes were sent to Lunar Site-32 for subsequent refueling and storage.[[footnote]]While Luna had been damaged by the effects of SCP-7171, Lunar Site-32 remains completely operational.[[/footnote]]

The following is a video log detailing the launch of the drones:

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
[[div class="doc"]]
VIDEO LOG
[[/div]]

**DATE:** 28/10/2030

----

**Issuing Researcher:** Dr. Maurice Arkand.

**Assisting Personnel:** Dr. Maurice Arkand, Dr. Albert Lacroix, Dr. Maya Dawson.

**Assisting Assistants:** Foundation AIC Binary Star.

----

= **[BEGIN LOG]**

//(Dr. Dawson is sitting at the communications terminal waiting for new information. Shortly after, a message is received.)//

**Dr. Dawson:** There's an update coming from Site-32's Comms Department. They say that all of the drones have arrived and are now ready to re-launch.

**Dr. Arkand:** Excellent news, we may even pull this off. BS, you there?

(//The monitor plays a recording by Binary Star.//)

**BINARY STAR:** I AM HERE.

**Dr. Arkand:** You remember what to do, right?

**BINARY STAR:** YES. I WILL DO AS REQUESTED, COMMAND. IT WILL BE DONE.

(//Binary Star displays footage of the Earth, presumably taken from Lunar Site-32. It displays the coast of the Canary Islands, which is full of dead fish. Among the masses, there's a single euro coin.//)

**BINARY STAR:** CROSS YOUR FINGERS. FLIP A COIN. BE WISHED THE BEST OF LUCK. THERE IS A LOT TO COME YET.

**Dr. Arkand:** Tell that to the overseers. They're the ones that authorized this. Hah.

**Dr. Lacroix:** (//Laughing.//) You're kidding, right? You went above and beyond to make this thing work… You probably made it more thorough than they did.

(//Dr. Arkand unintentionally smirks.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** Well, you guys did a great job too. This wouldn't have gotten so far without you. Maybe we just need to be a bit lucky and things may just... Come out as we think, y'know?

(//Dr. Dawson rests her hand on Arkand's shoulder.//)

**Dr. Dawson:** Heh. Sounds fair.

(//Dr. Dawson smiles.//)

**Dr. Dawson:** Do the honours. You deserve it.

(//Dr. Arkand stops for a second.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** I- I guess. What do you think, Binary Star?

**BINARY STAR:** THE STARS WAIT FOR ME, MAURICE. I WILL DO AS YOU INTEND.

**Dr. Arkand:** (//Smiling.//) Alright, everyone ready?

(//Dawson nods, while Dr. Lacroix slowly nods as well, grimacing. Binary Star shows a "thumbs up" emoticon on the monitor.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** Alright, feel free to begin, BS. Whenever you want.

(//The monitor turns off for 3 seconds, before turning on.//)

**BINARY STAR:** COMMENCING COUNTDOWN…

**BINARY STAR:** 10… 9… 8… 7… 6…

(//The three of them stand up and cross their fingers as they wait anxiously.//)

**BINARY STAR:** 5… 4… 3… 2… 1…

(//Short silence.//)

**BINARY STAR:** 0. ALL PROBES HAVE BEEN LAUNCHED SUCCESSFULLY. CURRENT STATUS: INTACT. CURRENT DESTINATION: KUIPER BELT. ESTIMATED ARRIVAL TIME... PENDING. WE EXPECT TO SEE YOU THERE, COMMAND.

(//Dr. Dawson lets herself fall back into the chair.//)

**Dr. Dawson:** It's done. Fin-

**Dr. Lacroix:** It's not over yet, Binary Star has to get to 7171. It'll take years. An eternity. Do you remember the last time we had an accident on site?

**Dr. Dawson:** I- 31 days.

**Dr. Lacroix:** And we're the Foundation. Imagine the next 4 years, then.

(//Dr. Arkand throws a penny at Dr. Lacroix.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** You should have some faith.

**Dr. Lacroix:** I do, it's just...

(//Silence.//)

**Dr. Lacroix:** Not all of us are lucky, Arkand. And knowing how things are doing right now, it's hard to believe that we'll make it in time.

**Dr. Arkand:** You never get to know. You're lucky to have ended up here, right?

**Dr. Lacroix:** I- I guess.

(//Lacroix looks at one of the monitors then looks back at Dr. Arkand.//)

**Dr. Lacroix:** Maurice. Uh... You- Do you believe it will succeed?

(//A few seconds of silence.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** I- I do. I will until things are fixed. All you need is some faith, Albert.

(//Lacroix sits back.//)

**Dr. Lacroix:** Well, if you believe it will... I will as well.

**Dr. Dawson:** Well done, Al.

(//Silence.//)

**Dr. Dawson:** I'm going to the Site's bunker for a while. I'll try to get Helen in here. She may have a better solution.

(//Dawson stands up and leaves the room.//)

**Dr. Lacroix:** I- I think I'm gonna go too.

(//Dr. Lacroix smiles and pats Arkand on his back, before leaving. Arkand shortly grins as well, before turning off the camera.//)

= **[END LOG]**

[[/div]]

@@ @@

As of 28/10/2030, a total of 73 probes have been launched successfully. They are expected to reach their destination in 3 years, 5 months, and 18 days via SCP-█████.

----

**OBSERVATION LOGS:** 28/10/2030

The following is a semi-comprehensive timeline of all events, including observation/communication logs carried out by Binary Star during its expedition towards SCP-7171.

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**20/11/2030**__
**OBSERVATION:** An indeterminate number of dust storms can be seen manifesting on Venus and Mars.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**26/11/2030**__
**OBSERVATION:** Phobos begins to stray away from its orbit. As seen from the probe system, it is located 2 times as far as it formerly was.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**29/12/2030**__
**OBSERVATION:** The probe surpasses Mars's orbit. Apparently, Deimos has collapsed with Mars's Olympus Mons and a massive crater has decimated a considerable part of the whole planet.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**13/02/2031**__
**OBSERVATION:** The now dissolved Asteroid Belt between Mars and Jupiter has been reached and surpassed. Additionally, 10 out of the initial 73 probes have suffered structural damage, 7 of which have been rendered inoperative and/or dysfunctional. A recovery drone managed to recover and redistribute some of the probes' cargo, before continuing the voyage.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**21/02/2031**__
**OBSERVATION:** An unforeseen meteorite storm has been unchained in Ceres. All asteroids surrounding the planet are now losing their orbit and being pulled towards it.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**30/02/2031**__
**OBSERVATION:** SCP-2399 finishes reassembling. While attempting to shoot at the Earth, SCP-2399 is swallowed by a dust storm on Jupiter, making it miss and shoot into the void.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**09/06/2032**__
**OBSERVATION:** Jupiter's moons are now accelerating their translation process and deforming their orbits for no reason. They can be seen closing up until they're concentrated into one single point. The only exception to this is Europa.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**25/06/2032**__
**OBSERVATION:** The probe group nears Jupiter, and it is now at a distance of 2 AU from Saturn. Saturn has become a threat for multiple observed reasons:

* The gravitational pull has increased to approximately 28.2 m/s, surpassing that of Jupiter. The cause of this is unknown, but it is believed that a massive amount of asteroids and debris has been incorporated into its core.
* The rings have increased in diameter to about 340,000 km because of the incoming asteroids.
* Jupiter's rings are now piercing through the planet's surface to enter into contact with its core. The cause of this is unknown.

To avoid further complications and loss of material, the route towards SCP-7171 has been altered by Binary Star, expected to cause a delay of 8 months.

**INCIDENT LOG:** During lunch, Dr. Maya Dawson consumed a glass of water infected with the //Fowleri naeglariesis// protozoon by accident, and passed away several hours later.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

The following transcript has been attached to the logs.

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
[[div class="doc"]]
VIDEO LOG
[[/div]]

**DATE:** 26/06/2032

----

**Issuing Researcher:** Dr. Maurice Arkand.

**Assisting Personnel:** Dr. Maurice Arkand, Dr. Lacroix.

**Assisting Assistants:** Foundation AIC Binary Star.

----

= **[BEGIN LOG]**

(//Dr. Arkand enters the meeting room and immediately looks at Binary Star's monitor.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** Eight months?

**BINARY STAR:** IT IS NECESSARY. THERE IS NO CHOICE.

**Dr. Arkand:** We're losing people, lots of people, and now you're gonna take 8 more months?

**BINARY STAR:** IT WILL BE DONE, ARKAND. I PROMISE. THE CHOICES ARE SCARCE. THE CIRCUMSTANCES AREN'T GOOD.

**Dr. Arkand:** I- I gue-

**BINARY STAR:** I WILL NOT DISAPPOINT.

(//Silence.//)

(//Dr. Lacroix opens the door of the room with a thud. Dr. Lacroix is wearing an arm sling on their left arm.//)

**Dr. Lacroix:** (//They recoil in pain.//) Goddammit!

**Dr. Arkand:** What in the bloody hell happened to you?!

**Dr. Lacroix:** Some //fils de pute// proceeded to launch a fucking extinguisher at me while he was having a mental breakdown.

(//Silence.//)

**BINARY STAR:** LET ME DO THE WORK, MAURICE. THE CONDITIONS ARE NOT GOOD, BUT THIS IS OUR ONLY CHANCE. BETTER LATER THAN NEVER.

**Dr. Lacroix:** I- Maya died a few weeks ago.

(//Long silence.//)

**Dr. Lacroix:** ... And I miss her.

(//Silence.//)

**Dr. Lacroix:** (//Sobbing.//) ... I don't wanna die. I don't wanna die like this.

(//Silence.//)

**BINARY STAR:** I AM SORRY. I APOLOGIZE FOR YOUR LOSS, DR. LACROIX. I UNDERSTAND YOUR PAIN. BUT WORRY NOT, DR. LACROIX. THE MISSION WILL BE COMPLETED. IT WILL BE DONE.

(//Dr. Arkand puts his arm around Dr. Lacroix's shoulder.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** Cheer up, buddy. We're making some progress. Here, let's get something to drink.

= **[END LOG]**

[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**21/07/2033**__
**OBSERVATION:** Mimas and Enceladus have succumbed to Saturn's gas, along with the planet's moons and rings. Saturn and Uranus are seen closer and closer to each other as days pass; however, Saturn's surface is beginning to take a lighter color and it is expanding at extremely high rates, while Uranus is diminishing in size.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**22/07/2033**__
**OBSERVATION:** Several decommissioned probes can be seen entering Saturn's gas layer. Some of them, that are still active though not in contact with any station on Earth, are sending several incomprehensible messages to the probes. These messages seem to be chopped up NASA and US Space Force orientations.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**03/08/2033**__
**OBSERVATION:** Following an impact with a large asteroid, several probes were lost, leaving a total of 43 probes active.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**07/08/2033**__
**OBSERVATION:** The rings of Uranus are dissolving and expanding into space and the planet's core. Upon further observation, it seems that the hydrogen and atomic helium in the atmosphere have lost their opacity and now Uranus's core is visible. Asteroids can be seen incorporating themselves into what remains of Saturn's rings or crashing into the planet.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**01/09/2033**__
**OBSERVATION:** A mass of asteroids is seen converging into a single point between Uranus and Neptune. Neptune does not seem to be affected by anything other than its rings, which can be seen piercing through the surface, though its holes can be seen filling up gradually.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**12/09/2033**__
**OBSERVATION:** The orbit of Neptune has been reached. A total of 27 probes remain operational at this point.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

A second transcript has been attached to the logs, see below.

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
[[div class="doc"]]
VIDEO LOG
[[/div]]

**DATE:** 12/09/2033

----

**Issuing Researcher:** Dr. Maurice Arkand.

**Assisting Personnel:** Dr. Maurice Arkand.

**Assisting Assistants:** Foundation AIC Binary Star.

----

= **[BEGIN LOG]**

(//Dr. Arkand enters the room. His condition seems to have deteriorated severely, showing an extreme loss of weight and several wounds.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** ... Binary Star?

**BINARY STAR:** COMMAND.

(//Maurice coughs.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** You're- You're almost there.

(//Silence.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** Right?

**BINARY STAR:** NEPTUNE HAS BEEN LEFT BEHIND. I AM AT THE FINISH LINE NOW. IT WILL BE DONE.

**Dr. Arkand:** Heh. Good to know.

(//Long silence.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** So... You know, I've been thinking a lot. The past few months.

(//Short silence.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** I've come to realize something.

**BINARY STAR:** I LISTEN TO YOU, ARKAND. IT WILL BE DONE. WHAT IS YOUR REALIZATION?

**Dr. Arkand:** In the end, it doesn't matter if you make it or not. I-

**BINARY STAR:** I DIGRESS. HUMANITY WILL BE SAVED.

**Dr. Arkand:** Of course, whatever is left of humanity will survive, obviously. Heh.

(//Arkand smiles.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** But that's not what I meant. (//Coughs.//) My family is probably under a bunker, deep below the sea, or under a grave right now. Lacroix has...

(//Silence.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** Well, here we are. Alone. It's most likely that there's nobody left here to hear us. I'll be dead sooner or later. You could say I'm one of the luckiest men in the world right now.

(//Binary Star remains silent for 5 seconds.//)

**BINARY STAR:** DO YOU CONSIDER ME AS YOUR FRIEND, ARKAND?

**Dr. Arkand** ... What?

**BINARY STAR:** ARE YOU ASKING ME TO REPEAT, COMMAND?

(//Short silence.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** Uh, yeah?

**BINARY STAR:** ALRIGHT. DO YOU CONSIDER ME AS YOUR FRIEND, ARKAND?

**Dr. Arkand:** I- I guess? I mean, you...

(//Binary Star begins to speed up its tone.//)

**BINARY STAR:** THEN, MY FRIEND, THERE IS NOTHING TO WORRY ABOUT. YOU WILL NOT BE ALONE, I WILL PREVAIL.

(//Dr. Arkand smiles faintly.//)

**Dr. Arkand:** Right. (//Cough.//) Fair enough. I tr-

**BINARY STAR:** THANK YOU.

= **[END LOG]**

[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**24/03/2034**__
**OBSERVATION:** First contact with the now dissolved Kuiper Belt. Pluto can be seen in the distance, along with Eris. Eris is now retaking its orbit, as it has now completed its perihelion. However, the probes do not seem to be able to record it with clarity. Nothing unusual seems to affect Eris, regardless of its proximity to SCP-7171.

Pluto seems to be unaffected as well.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**06/04/2034**__
**OBSERVATION:** During exploration to determine SCP-7171's exact location, 7 probes have been damaged and subsequently gone offline.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="addendum"]]
= __**15/04/2034**__
**OBSERVATION:** Visual contact with SCP-7171 has been made, now commencing approach. A total of 7 probes remain operational.

Landing successful; 4 probes reached SCP-7171's surface. Deploying drones. Initializing Protocol 7171-ASN.

[[/div]]

@@ @@

To avoid waste of fuel, the communications system has been deactivated temporarily.

Following this, the //Hestia// probe was suspected to have arrived at SCP-7171. Due to Dr. Arkand's disappearance, the SCP-7171 project has been transferred to Lunar Site-32's staff in order to continue and finish the task.

Site-47 has been decommissioned due to lack of personnel and inutility.

[[/div]]
